marketNews.title: PGAS Adds More Than 71.8 BBtud of Gas Supply
marketNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) announced an additional gas supply of more than 71.83 billion standard cubic meters (BBtud) that was signed at the IPA Convention & Exhibition on Wednesday, 21 May. The additional gas supply comes from several blocks, detailed as follows: For the domestic gas-swap agreement, the contract stipulates that a volume of pipeline gas from the Corridor Block and Jabung Block, previously sold to Singapore, will be replaced by gas from the Natuna blocks (South Natuna Sea Block B, Natuna Sea Block A, and PSC Kakap). The volume previously sold to Singapore will be re-allocated to meet domestic gas demand, with PGAS acting as the domestic buyer. The added gas supply, sourced from various oil-and-gas blocks in both pipeline and LNG form, provides supply certainty for Sumatra and western Java. Previously, PGAS President Director Arief S. Handoko warned that a gas deficit in western Java to northern Sumatra would occur in 2025-2035, driven by natural declining of existing suppliers that cannot be offset by new reserve discoveries or production from new gas fields. It is still unknown whether the additional supply will be allocated to the gas-price incentive (HGBT) or non-HGBT. Previously, the government set the HGBT gas price at USD 6.5-7 per MMBtu from January 2025 for five years, and any purchase exceeding the quota will be charged a regasification tariff of USD 16.77 per MMBtu. The Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Association, Edy Suyanto, said that the fulfillment of the HGBT volume quota has been falling, with the western Java quota dropping to 65.3% in April 2025 (versus 77% in March 2025) and eastern Java falling to 48.8% (versus 61% in March 2025).

marketNews.title: ANTM Seeks US$500 Million Syndicated Loan
marketNews.content: The Antam (ANTM) is reported by Bloomberg to be seeking a syndicated loan of US$500 million (approximately IDR 8.2 trillion), which could become the first dollar-denominated syndicated loan for a state-owned enterprise in 2025. Bloomberg says the loan has a five-year tenor and will be used for general corporate purposes such as capital expenditure and working capital. The facility will be coordinated by United Overseas Bank and will consist of a term loan and a revolving credit facility.

marketNews.title: AADI Approves 2024 Dividend of About US$2.2 Billion (183% Payout)
marketNews.content: Shareholders of Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) approved a 2024 fiscal-year dividend of approximately US$2.2 billion, equivalent to a 183% dividend payout ratio. The full amount was paid in June 2024, prior to the company’s IPO, and no additional dividend will be paid. The decision aligns with the Stockbit Commentary posted in March 2025.

marketNews.title: ELSA Approves 2024 Dividend of IDR 285.5 Billion (40% Payout)
marketNews.content: Shareholders of Elnusa (ELSA) approved a 2024 fiscal-year dividend of approximately IDR 285.5 billion, or IDR 39.11 per share, representing a 40% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of 8.2% as of Thursday 22 May. The cum-date and payment date have not been disclosed.

marketNews.title: ENRG Signs 25% Kangean Participation Purchase and 50% Gebang Sale to Japex
marketNews.content: Energi Mega Persada (ENRG) signed a purchase agreement for a 25% participation right in the Kangean Block from Japan Petroleum Exploration Co. Ltd. (Japex) for an undisclosed amount. Upon completion, ENRG will become the sole operator of the Kangean Block through its subsidiaries. In a separate transaction, ENRG signed an agreement to sell a 50% participation right in the Gebang Block to Japex, also for an undisclosed amount; after the transaction, ENRG’s participation in Gebang will fall to 50%. ENRG said the partnership with Japex will accelerate gas-field development through better financing, advanced subsurface modelling, and more efficient project execution.

marketNews.title: MAIN Approves 2024 Dividend of IDR 145.5 Billion (30% Payout)
marketNews.content: Shareholders of Malindo Feedmill (MAIN) approved a 2024 fiscal-year dividend of approximately IDR 145.5 billion, or IDR 65 per share, representing roughly a 30% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of 8.5% as of Thursday 22 May. The cum-date and payment date have not been announced.

marketNews.title: INTP Approves 2024 Dividend of IDR 867.6 Billion (43% Payout)
marketNews.content: Shareholders of Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) approved on Wednesday 21 May a 2024 fiscal-year dividend of approximately IDR 867.6 billion, or IDR 259 per share, representing about a 43% dividend payout ratio (versus roughly 16% in 2023) and an implied dividend yield of 4.6% as of Thursday 22 May. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 2 June 2025, with payment scheduled for 20 June 2025.

marketNews.title: KLBF Approves 2024 Dividend of IDR 1.7 Trillion (52% Payout)
marketNews.content: Shareholders of Kalbe Farma (KLBF) approved a 2024 fiscal-year dividend of IDR 1.7 trillion, or IDR 36 per share, representing a 52% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of 2.5% as of Thursday 22 May. The cum-date and payment date have not been disclosed. Shareholders also approved the appointment of Ronny Hadiana as the principal commissioner and Herijanto Irawan as an independent commissioner.

marketNews.title: KIJA Reports IDR 1.1 Trillion 1Q25 Land Sale and IDR 1.2 Trillion Marketing Sales
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Jababeka Industrial Estate (KIJA), Muljadi Suganda, said to Kontan that the company recorded industrial land sales of about IDR 1.1 trillion in 1Q25, a 117% year-over-year increase from IDR 504.5 billion in 1Q24. During 1Q25, KIJA recorded marketing sales of IDR 1.2 trillion, an 88% year-over-year rise, equal to 34% of the 2025 target of IDR 3.5 trillion.

marketNews.title: PACK Plans IDR 70 Billion Divestiture of Plastic Packaging Business
marketNews.content: Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama announced a plan to divest its plastic packaging business – comprising all assets and liabilities related to the business – for IDR 70 billion to a non-affiliated party. The amount equals 121% of the company’s total equity at the end of 2024. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 30 June 2025.

marketNews.title: KPPU Reviews Potential Grab-GoTo Merger Risks
marketNews.content: The Competition Commission (KPPU) Chair Muhammad Fanshurullah Asa said on Wednesday 21 May that the agency has begun a review to identify risks from a possible merger between Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) and GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO). Grab and GoTo have not formally confirmed a merger, but Reuters reports the two companies are working toward an agreement in 2Q25.

marketNews.title: BPJS Ketenagakerjaan Projects 280,000 Potential Layoffs in 2025
marketNews.content: The BPJS Ketenagakerjaan Board Chair Muhammad Zuhri said on Wednesday 21 May that the agency estimates the number of workers affected by layoffs could rise to 280,000 in 2025, a 259% year-over-year increase from the 2024 level of 77,965 workers. The number of unemployment-benefit claims in the first four months of 2025 has reached 52,850, nearly matching the 57,960 claims recorded in 2024.

marketNews.title: Government Nears Finalisation of Gross-Split Tax Rule Revision
marketNews.content: The head of Indonesia’s oil-and-gas regulator, Djoko Siswanto, said the government is finalising a revision of the tax rules for oil-and-gas contractors that use the gross-split scheme. The amendment, expected to be issued soon, aims to boost upstream investment by simplifying the gross-split contract, covering indirect tax, DMO fuel price, monitoring and evaluation based on a single parameter.

marketNews.title: Government Appoints State-Owned Enterprise as Holding for BPI Danantara
marketNews.content: State-owned enterprise minister Erick Thohir said on Wednesday 21 May that the government has appointed a state-owned enterprise to serve as the investment holding for BPI Danantara. He did not disclose the identity of the enterprise, but explained that the company has long operated in the investment sector and will operate under the BPI Danantara umbrella. Previously, the government had designated PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia as the operational holding for BPI Danantara.

marketNews.title: Freeport Indonesia Smelter Resumes Operations Ahead of Schedule
marketNews.content: Freeport Indonesia’s President Director Tony Wenas said the company’s smelter in JIIPE, Gresik resumed operations earlier than expected. The smelter is expected to start producing copper cathode in the fourth week of June 2025 and to reach full-capacity production in December 2025.

marketNews.title: Bitcoin Hits All-Time High Near US$110,000 Amid Stablecoin Bill Progress
marketNews.content: Bitcoin reached an all-time high, rising almost 3% to around US$110,000 on Thursday 22 May morning, following progress on a U.S. Senate-pending stablecoin bill. Bloomberg reported that bipartisan senators hope the legislation will be passed this week, though the final vote could be delayed until after the Memorial Day recess on 26 May 2025.

marketNews.title: ISSP Shareholder Cakra Bhakti Increases Stake to 56.28%
marketNews.content: The controlling shareholder of the Indonesia Steel Pipe Industry (ISSP), PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra, purchased approximately 11.1 million ISSP shares at IDR 295 per share on 21 May 2025, a total transaction value of about IDR 3.3 billion. After the transaction, PT Cakra Bhakti’s ownership in ISSP rose from 56.12% to 56.28%.

marketNews.title: Attorney General Names Three Suspects in SRIL Loan Fraud Case
marketNews.content: The Attorney General’s Office on Wednesday 21 May named three individuals as suspects in a corruption case involving a loan to Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL). The suspects are former SRIL President Director Iwan Setiawan Lukminto, former Bank DKI President Director Zainuddin Mappa, and former West Java and Banten Regional Development Bank (BJBR) official Dicky Syahbandinata. The alleged loan, unsecured, totals roughly IDR 693 billion. The Attorney General’s Office director Abdul Qohar said the bank officials failed to conduct adequate analysis and did not follow loan-granting procedures.
